alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Marshall; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 2:14PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marshall, southwestern Rutherford, southeastern Williamson and northwestern Bedford Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 213 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Murfreesboro, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelbyville, Eagleville, Rover, Christiana, Deason, Rockvale, Unionville and Fosterville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 between mile markers 87 and 91. Interstate 840 near mile marker 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
